channel.title: MySQL Website Error?
channel.description:
I downloaded a website template. (google Website) Then I registered a 000webhost account. Then I transfered it all to my website database, (in public_html) No errors, all the files went through. Then I go to the website, and it says:
[code] MySQL server is overloaded, please try again in a few minutes. MySQL Said: Access denied for user 'freewebsite_themes'@'localhost' (using password: YES) [/code] So I thought, I have to set it up for my MySQL Database. So I went to 000webhost, and made a database, set it all up, and now it says this:
[code] MySQL server is overloaded, please try again in a few minutes. MySQL Said: Access denied for user 'a3776688_test'@'localhost' (using password: YES) [/code]
My MySQL Database isn't overloaded at all.
Any idea how to fix this?

item.title: MySQL Website Error?
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

I setup a webhost at 000webhost last year and it’s still in process last time I checked.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Website Error?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:7, topic:440966”]Not sure about the overload part, but unless you’re using a paid account I’m pretty sure 000webhost doesn’t allow external mysql access.[/quote]Yes it does.

I have a solution to your problem; don’t use 000webhost. It’s terrible.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Website Error?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Not sure about the overload part, but unless you’re using a paid account I’m pretty sure 000webhost doesn’t allow external mysql access.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Website Error?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

The only thing I can think of is that maybe, instead of creating a connection to the server once, each page is creating it’s own connection to the database.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Website Error?
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Level 120 Dungeoneering, post:4, topic:440966”]I know it’s the right password because I typed it in several times.

I know it’s not overloaded because it’s brand new with nothing on it.[/quote]

000webhost is a shared webhost (atleast if you’re using a free version - all I know), so it is quite possible the server is being overloaded by many other websites using the same MySQL server.

Read full topic

item.description:

I know it’s not overloaded because it’s brand new with nothing on it.

How do you know it’s actually not overloaded?

item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

it says access denied, so its using the wrong password… try fixing that?

nice name btw so long lol

item.title: MySQL Website Error?
item.dc:creator: @Level_120_Dungeoneer Level 120 Dungeoneering
item.description:
@Level_120_Dungeoneer wrote:

I downloaded a website template. (google Website) Then I registered a 000webhost account. Then I transfered it all to my website database, (in public_html) No errors, all the files went through. Then I go to the website, and it says:

MySQL server is overloaded, please try again in a few minutes.
MySQL Said: Access denied for user 'freewebsite_themes'@'localhost' (using password: YES)

So I thought, I have to set it up for my MySQL Database. So I went to 000webhost, and made a database, set it all up, and now it says this:

MySQL server is overloaded, please try again in a few minutes.
MySQL Said: Access denied for user 'a3776688_test'@'localhost' (using password: YES)

My MySQL Database isn’t overloaded at all.

Any idea how to fix this?
